com.pddstudio.networkutils

Class PortService

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.pddstudio.networkutils.abstracts.AbstractService
      • com.pddstudio.networkutils.PortService

  • public class PortService
extends AbstractService
    A Service to scan for open ports (TCP) on a given target.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Modifier Constructor and Description
      protected PortService(ProcessCallback processCallback) 

    • Method Summary

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      PortService addPort(int port)
      Adds the specified port to the list for required ports to scan for.

      Adds the specified ports to the list of required ports to scan for.

      The return type of this service.
      void scan()
      Starts the scanning process.
      PortService setTargetAddress(java.lang.String targetAddress)
      Sets the target address (by default localhost) where to scan for open ports.
      void stop()
      Stops the scanning process.

    • Method Detail

      • setTargetAddress

        public PortService setTargetAddress(java.lang.String targetAddress)
        Sets the target address (by default localhost) where to scan for open ports.
        Parameters:
        targetAddress - - The target address.
        Returns:
        The current PortService instance.

      • addPort

        public PortService addPort(int port)
        Adds the specified port to the list for required ports to scan for.
        Parameters:
        port - - the port to scan for.
        Returns:
        The current PortService instance.

      • addPorts

        public PortService addPorts(java.lang.Integer... ports)
        Adds the specified ports to the list of required ports to scan for.
        Parameters:
        ports - - The ports to scan for, separated by comma [,]
        Returns:
        The current PortService instance.

      • addPortRange

        public PortService addPortRange(int from,
                       int until)
        Adds the specified range of ports using the provided start- and endpoint. For example using addPortRange(int, int) with a range of 1, 900 will add all ports from 1 until 900 to the list of required ports to scan for.
        Parameters:
        from - - The port range's starting point.
        until - - The port range's ending point.
        Returns:
        The current PortService instance.

      • scan

        public void scan()
        Starts the scanning process.

      • stop

        public void stop()
        Stops the scanning process.

      • getResponseType

        public java.lang.Object getResponseType()
        The return type of this service. Objects retrieved via ProcessCallback.onProcessUpdate(Object) must be casted to PortResponse in order to be able to work with the response.
        Specified by:
        getResponseType in class AbstractService
        Returns:
        PortResponse
